dt: {bc}to seize and take away (a person) by force
{bc}to draw or spread away (a part of the body, such as a limb or the fingers) from a position near or parallel to the median axis of the body or from the axis of a limb

et: borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}abdūctus{/it}, past participle of {it}abdūcere{/it} "to draw (a limb) away from the body," going back to Latin "to lead away, carry off, remove, entice away," from {it}ab-{/it} {et_link|ab-|ab-} + {it}dūcere{/it} "to lead" {ma}{mat|tow:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to seize and take away (a person) by force
to draw or spread away (a part of the body, such as a limb or the fingers) from a position near or parallel to the median axis of the body or from the axis of a limb
